page.title: 15ST. MARY'S HIGH SCHOOL
page.content: St. Mary's High School was opened in 1960 and was one of the first secondary schools to be opened in Co. Derry. There are now 997 pupils and 63 teachers at the school. The original school was extended in 1974 and is due further extension in the next few years. Although the original school catered for the 11-15 age range the raising of the school leaving age to 16 and the introduction of "A" level courses now means that children can attend from 11-18. Children come from the primary schools in Limavady and the neighbouring parishes of Faughanvale and Magilligan.
